context_of_use: This use case allows users to manage their account access securely.
description: Covers user registration, login, logout and password reset to control secure access.
preconditions: User must have a valid email address for registration.
postconditions: User is logged in to the system.
assumptions: User has the necessary information to register an account.
User can remember their password or has access to reset it.
requirements_met: The system shall allow users to register an account.
The system shall allow users to log in securely.
The system shall allow users to reset their password.
outstanding_issues: Need to define password complexity requirements.
Need to establish account recovery procedures.
main_flow: 1. User registers account → System creates user account and confirms registration.
2. User logs in → System authenticates user and grants access.
3. User resets password → System updates password and confirms reset.
alternative_flows: AF-1 (from Step 1): If the email is already registered, the system prompts the user to log in instead.
AF-2 (from Step 2): If the login fails, the system displays an error message and allows retry.
exception_flows: EF-1 (from Step 1): If the registration fails due to invalid data, the system displays an error message.
